name: Invesco DB US Dollar Index Bearish Fund
description: The Invesco DB US Dollar Index Bearish Fund (UDN) is an exchange-traded fund that seeks to provide investors with a way to profit from a decline in the value of the U.S. dollar relative to a basket of foreign currencies. Launched in 2007, this fund is designed to track the performance of the Deutsche Bank Long US Dollar Futures Index, which is comprised of a basket of currencies including the Euro, Japanese Yen, British Pound, Canadian Dollar, Swedish Krona, and Swiss Franc. UDN provides investors with an opportunity to hedge against dollar strength or to gain exposure to foreign currencies in a cost-effective manner. The fund primarily invests in futures contracts and aims to reflect the performance of the underlying index, which is designed to have a negative correlation to the U.S. dollar. UDN is particularly appealing to investors looking for diversification in their portfolios or those who believe that the dollar will weaken against other major currencies. With a transparent structure and low expense ratios, UDN serves as a practical tool for both retail and institutional investors seeking to manage currency risk or speculate on currency movements.

faq.question: How does UDN work?
faq.answer: UDN invests in futures contracts to track the performance of the Deutsche Bank Long US Dollar Futures Index, aiming to reflect a negative correlation to the U.S. dollar.

faq.question: Who manages UDN?
faq.answer: UDN is managed by Invesco, a global investment management firm.
